intro: Odostemon, commonly known as the golden rain tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, Africa, and the Americas. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers that resemble those of the acacia. Odostemon species are often used in ornamental horticulture due to their attractive foliage and floral display. They also have some traditional medicinal uses in various cultures.
